newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SWIMMING-HICKMAN WINS MEN'S 200 BUTTERFLY WORLD TITLE.
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-HICKMAN WINS MEN'S 200 BUTTERFLY WORLD TITLE.

text.p: James Hickman brought Britain a gold medal at the world short-course swimming championships on Saturday with a hard-fought victory in the men's 200 metres butterfly.
Hickman edged Ukraine's Denis Silantiev and Australian defending champion Scott Goodman to win his first global title in one minute 55.55 seconds.
Silantiev, who had seized the early lead from Canada's Przemyslav Pietucha and held it through the 150-metre mark, took the silver in 1:55.76 and Goodman the bronze in 1:55.94.
Russian double Olympic champion Denis Pankratov failed to qualify for the final, capping a disappointing week in which he was also denied a place in Thursday's 100 butterfly final.
Pankratov, holder of all the long-course and short-course butterfly world records, finished ninth overall in the morning heats. He pulled out of the consolation B final.
